name: (3-methylnaphthalen-2-yl)methyl trifluoroacetate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2383
Reason:
The compound has a naphthalene-like structure with a methyl group attached to the 2-position and a trifluoroacetate group attached to the 1-position. The naphthalene ring is planar and aromatic, which can contribute to increased intermolecular interactions and therefore a higher melting point. The methyl group at the 2-position can also contribute to increased hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, further increasing the melting point. The trifluoroacetate group can participate in hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions as well, but its presence may reduce the melting point due to the increased steric hindrance.

Starting with a base melting point of around 40°C for naphthalene, the addition of the methyl group and trifluoroacetate group can increase the melting point by approximately 20°C and 10°C, respectively. The estimated total increase in melting point is around 30°C.
